pose.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to exist in a way that may cause a problem, danger, difficulty etc

pose.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
pose.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: to dress or behave like a rich and fashionable person in order to make other people notice you or admire you
pose.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: The chemical leak poses a threat to human health.

pose.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc
pose.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Ann struck a pose (=stood or sat in a particular position) and smiled for the camera.
a painting of the Duchess in a dramatic pose
pose.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: behaviour in which someone pretends to have a quality or social position they do not really have, usually in order to make other people notice them or admire them
pose.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Her confidence was merely a pose to hide her uncertainty.
